alert.note: Alert for Coosa; Elmore; Macon (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:34PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Elmore, west central Macon, northeastern Montgomery and southeastern Coosa Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 534 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pentonville to near Tysonville. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Montgomery, Wetumpka, Equality, Milstead, Eclectic, Shorter, Speed, Pentonville, Santuck, Emerald Mountain, Mount Meigs, Tysonville, Victoryland, Blue Ridge, Nixburg, Waugh, Dexter, Auburn University In Montgomery, Western Lake Martin and Claud. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
